Benjamin Bach.Bio: Lecturer (Assistant Prof.) in Design Informatics and Visualization at the University of Edinburgh. His research designs and investigates interactive information visualization interfaces to help people explore, communicate, and understand data across media such as screens, mixed reality, paper, and physicalizations.

Uta Hinrichs.Bio: Reader (Associate Prof.) in Data Visualisation and researcher at Design Informatics and the Edinburgh Futures Institute at the University of Edinburgh. Visualization as part of Humanities Research, Digital Humanities, Visualization of Cultural Collections, Data Physicalization, Visualization and Interaction Design Processes and Prototyping, Visualization Teaching & Learning, Qualitative Research Methods.

Bettina Nissen.Bio: Lecturer (Assistant Prof.) in Interaction Design and researcher in Design Informatics at the University of Edinburgh. With a background in product and interaction design, digital fabrication and data physicalisation, her practice-based research focuses on engaging audiences with complex technological concepts and data through tangible means and makings. Research through Design, Designing with Data, Data Engagement, Data Physicalisation, Digital Fabrication.

Larissa Pschetz.Bio: interaction designer, researcher and lecturer at the University of Edinburgh. Research through design, Technology for social development, Internet of Things (IoT), Temporal design, Biodesign

James Scott-Brown.Bio: Postdoctoral researcher working on network visualization.

Devanjan Bhattacharya.Bio: is working with the PSRP and PeaceTech in School of Law, focussing on collaborative map visualisations for participation and mediation in peace processes, along with the School of Informatics and the School of Design.

Xinhuan Shu.Bio: postdoctoral researcher working on the Vistorian network visualization project. Her research explores innovative approaches to facilitate human-data interaction in data-driven communication and decision-making.

Tobias Kauer.Bio: PhD student working on Discursive Data Visualization.

Ryan Bowler.Bio: informatics PhD student researching ways to understand and implement the complexities of human time within Human-Computer-Interactions.

Lucy Havens.Bio: PhD Student on Retrieving Bias in Cultural Collections using Natural Language Processing and Visualization.

Sarah Sch√∂ttler.Bio: PhD student working on non-map-based ways of visualizing geographic data.

Rea Michalopoulou.Bio: PhD student working on child and adolescent understanding of COVID-19 and its impact on mental health while designing a novel Virtual Reality (VR) assessment tool for mental health.

Lara Johnson.Bio: PhD student researching health outcomes in later life.  She is interested in effective ways to communicate about emotionally difficult health topics which the general public may have a limited awareness of as well as negative or erroneous perceptions.
